subsection_content:
Symptoms usually appear within about 2 days of infection. Common symptoms include: (2)
Fever above 38.9°C.; Pain in the abdomen, back, side or groin. Often the pain is on one side; Painful urination, burning urination; Cloudy urine.; Presence of pus or blood in urine.; Urgent or forced urination; Urine has a fishy smell.
In addition, patients may experience accompanying symptoms such as chills, chills, nausea, vomiting, pain, fatigue, and mental confusion. (3)
Symptoms in children and older adults may be different from others. For example, mental disorders are common in older people and are often their only symptom.
People with chronic pyelonephritis may experience only mild symptoms or may even have no noticeable symptoms at all, leading to the condition being overlooked. (4)
subsection_title: viem be than.json. Symptoms of pyelonephritis

viem be than.json. Symptoms of pyelonephritis
Symptoms usually appear within about 2 days of infection. Common symptoms include: (2)
Fever above 38.9°C.; Pain in the abdomen, back, side or groin. Often the pain is on one side; Painful urination, burning urination; Cloudy urine.; Presence of pus or blood in urine.; Urgent or forced urination; Urine has a fishy smell.
In addition, patients may experience accompanying symptoms such as chills, chills, nausea, vomiting, pain, fatigue, and mental confusion. (3)
Symptoms in children and older adults may be different from others. For example, mental disorders are common in older people and are often their only symptom.
People with chronic pyelonephritis may experience only mild symptoms or may even have no noticeable symptoms at all, leading to the condition being overlooked. (4)
